intro: Satureja majoranifolia, commonly known as wild marjoram, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, pink or white flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are fragrant, with a strong, spicy scent similar to oregano and thyme. It is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its medicinal and aromatic properties.
